SCANDAL.Definition: (an action or event that causes ) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

ROCKED.Definition: caused feelings of shock or surprise

ROAM.Definition: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do

FLUTE.Definition: a tube-shaped musical instrument with a hole that you blow across at one end while holding the tube out horizontally to one side

COSMETICS.Definition: substances put on the face or body that are intended to improve its appearance or quality

INTRIGUE.Definition: to interest someone a lot, especially by being strange, unusual, or mysterious

ASTIGMATISM.Definition: a fault in the lens of the eye that reduces the quality of sight, especially a fault that stops the eye from focusing

CREDIBLE.Definition: able to be believed or trusted

SIGHTINGS.Definition: an occasion when you see something or someone, especially something that is rare or trying to hide

ANONYMOUS.Definition: made or done by someone whose name is not known or not made public

HOSTAGE.Definition: someone who is taken as a prisoner by an enemy in order to force the other people involved to do what the enemy wants

TAPE.Definition: thin plastic in a long, narrow strip with a magnetic covering that allows sounds or sounds and pictures to be recorded and played again, especially one on which sound is recorded

WHEREABOUTS.Definition: the place where a person or thing is

CLOSURE.Definition: the feeling or act of bringing an unpleasant situation, time, or experience to an end, so that you are able to start new activities

TOMB.Definition: a large stone structure or underground room where someone, especially an important person, is buried

CRYPT.Definition: a room under the floor of a church where bodies are buried

TIP-OFF.Definition: a secret warning or piece of secret information

CONCLUSIVE.Definition: proving that something is true, or ending any doubt

SWAP.Definition: to give something and be given something else instead

NUN.Definition: a member of a female religious group that lives in a convent

WRONGDOING.Definition: a bad or an illegal action

CLERK.Definition: a person who works in an office, dealing with records or performing general office duties

EXTORTING.Definition: to get something by force or threats, or with difficulty

KIDNAPPED.Definition: to take a person away illegally by force, usually in order to demand money in exchange for releasing them

EXORCIST.Definition: to force an evil spirit to leave a person or place by using prayers or magic

CONVENT.Definition: a building in which nuns (= members of a female religious order) live

INTRIGUING.Definition: to interest someone a lot, especially by being strange, unusual, or mysterious
